Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enterocin L50A (pediocin L50, EntL50A, Ent62-6A; Enterocin A5-11A; natural AMPs; a two-chain class 2b bacteriocin, UCLL2a; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes. XXI)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: EntL50 activity was maximally accumulated at 16 to 25°C and was not detected at 37°C or above.  leaderless, i.e. no signal peptide. The sequence of chain b (EntL50B) is MGAIAKLVFKFGWPLIKKFYKQIMQFIGQGWTIDQIEKWLKRH.Chemical modification: The N-terminal Met is formylated.Activity: EntL50A and EntL50B both possess antimicrobial activity on their own, with EntL50A being the most active. Supernatant containing Enterocin A5-11 inhibited several Lactobacillus spp. and food-borne pathogens E. coli, S. aureus and L. innocua.Synergy:AMPs:  when the two chains were combined, a considerable synergism was observed, especially with some indicator strains.Discovery: leaderless, i.e. no signal peptide.Peptide stability:  heat-stable and not sensitive to pH (pH-insensitive) (Batdorj  et al., 2006).Found in multiple species (both formylated and unformylated forms) (Hanchi et al., 2016). UPdated 3/2017; 7/2021; 8/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Cintas LM, Casaus P, Holo H, Hernandez PE, Nes IF, Håvarstein LS.1998
Literature Information.Title: Enterocins L50A and L50B, two novel bacteriocins from Enterococcus faecium L50, are related to staphylococcal hemolysins
